Secretary, cabinet procedure.(previous reference:Cabinet 4(29) , Con-conclusion 7*)lo The Cabinet agreed- (a) That the Secretary should communicate to all members of the Cabinet a Memo-randum he had already submitted to thePrime Minister on the subject of instructions-tions to the Secretary on Cabinet Procedure.(b) RESPONSIBILITY OF MINISTERS.That the responsibility for initiatingaction to give effect to cabinet decisions rests with the Ministers atthe head of the Departments concerned:also that the responsibility for initiating questions to be discussed by the Cabinet rests -with Ministers,subject to the provisions of Conclusion(h).(c) CABINET MINUTES.It is an instruction to the Secretary,in drafting Cabinet Minutes, to avoid any reference to opinions expressedby any Individual and to limit theMinutes as narrowly as possible to theactual decisions agreed to.(d) SECRECY OP CABINS T PROCEEDINGS.The utmost secrecy should be observed in regard to the proceedings of theCabinet by all concerned.(e) PRESS COMMUNIQUES.It is an instruction to the Secretaryto limit the Press Communique" to the names of the Ministers present. In anycase where a member of the Cabinet deemsit in the public interest to issue a press Communique or other announcementof a Cabinet decision he should firstconsult the Prime Minister.(f) MINISTERS OUTSIDE THE CABINET,.Subject to the authority of the PrimeMinister, the Secretary will communicate to Ministers who are not members of theCabinet any particular decision whichconcerns them, but subject to (g) below*(g) LAW OFFICERS.The Lord Chancellor will be responsiblefor communicating to the Law Officersof the. Crown such Cabinet decisions asconcern them, subject to consultationwith the Cabinet at the time the decision is taken, or subsequently with the PrimeMinister if he deems necessary. Ch) CONSULTATION WITH THE TREASURY.The rule hitherto in practice is main-tained under -which Memoranda, Draft Billsand other constituents of the Agenda paper of the Cabinet are sent to the cabinet secretariat for circulation only after their subject-matter has been fullerexamined between the Department fromwhich they emanate, the Treasury, theLaw Officers where contentious Billsare involved, and any other Departmentsconcerned.(i) CIRCULATION OF CABINET MINUTES.It is an instruction to the secretary that not more than one copy of cabinet minutes is sent to any Minister.(j) CUSTODY OF CABINET MINUTES BY MINISTERS.Cabinet Minutes are intended for the personal use of Ministers, and the utmostdiscretion must be exercised in disclosingtheir contents to any person who is not amember of the Cabinet. Members of theCabinet will open personally the specialenvelopes containing Cabinet Minutes.Ministers are themselves responsible for adminsitrative or other action within their Departments to give effect to them.Ministers are also responsible that appropriate arrangements are made by themselves or their Private Secretaries,under their personal supervision, for thesafe custody and for ensuring the secrecy of Cabinet Minutes.(k) CABINET KEYS.The Secretary should get into communica-tion with the Foreign Office with a viewto the supply of keys of Cabinet Boxesto Ministers with the least possible delay.(l) CABINET PROCEDURE.That the normal day and time for CabinetMeetings should be WEDNESDAYS, at 11 a.m. PROPOSEDINQUIRIESINTO -THE COTTONINDUSTRY(previous reference:Cabinet 43(28) , Con**elusion l)oTHE IRON ANDSTEEL INDUSTRY.(previous reference:Cabinet 5(29)j Con-clusion 4c)2.
